meanings.definition: Having a round or spherical shape.
meanings.sent1: The rotunder ball rolled smoothly down the hill.
meanings.sent2: The moon looked rotunder in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The rotunder pumpkin sat proudly on the porch.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks were as rotunder as ripe apples.
meanings.sent5: The rotunder clouds floated lazily across the sky.

meanings.definition: To become round or spherical in shape.
meanings.sent1: With time, the dough will rotunder as it rises.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar will rotunder into a butterfly.
meanings.sent3: I watched the balloon slowly rotunder as it filled with air.
meanings.sent4: The snowball began to rotunder as it rolled down the hill.
meanings.sent5: The clay will rotunder as the potter shapes it on the wheel.

meanings.sent1: She held the shiny rotunder in her hand.
meanings.sent2: The marble was a perfect rotunder.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with the small rotunder on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The crystal ball was a mysterious rotunder on the table.
meanings.sent5: The children chased after the bouncing rotunder in the yard.
